intro: Microcos psilonema, commonly known as the slender microcos, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in moist, sandy soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its delicate structure, it is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
